abstract.p: Correction; Jan 18 article about decision by Financial Accounting Standards Board not to delay rule that requires companies to take more stringent approach to reporting tax positions misstated name of organization that requested postponement; it is Tax Executives Institute, not Tax Executives International

block.p: An article by Dow Jones/Associated Press in Business Day last Thursday about a decision by the Financial Accounting Standards Board not to delay a rule that requires companies to take a more stringent approach to reporting tax positions misstated the name of the organization that had requested the postponement. It is Tax Executives Institute, not Tax Executives International.

An article by Dow Jones/Associated Press in Business Day last Thursday about a decision by the Financial Accounting Standards Board not to delay a rule that requires companies to take a more stringent approach to reporting tax positions misstated the name of the organization that had requested the postponement. It is Tax Executives Institute, not Tax Executives International.
